review: After seeing the ad on TV for the $6.95 burger and all you can eat fries, we had to visit today.  The burger was cooked nicely, pink in the middle for me and all done for my wife. The kids were happy, one with pizza and fries, the other corn dog and fries.  The staff was very attentive, even for how busy it was.  She was on the spot with more fries when needed and always had a great smile and paid some special attention to the kids.  The smoky fry sauce is wonderful!  Since the atmosphere is active, (people talking, laughing etc) I didn't feel like my kids had to be mimes.  Good visit and will come again!

Had the worst customer experience ever a few days ago. The waitress changed 5 times, barely asked us questions, interrupted conversations, and even got my order wrong. It was rude and worst restaurant experience ever in my whole life. I will never go back to this place

Red Robin rarely disappoints me! If you want some yummy greasy food to nurse a hangover, or you just want to indulge in some tasty American cuisine- it's your place! I think I have tried almost every burger here, and they are all yummy in my tummy! I think my favorite would have to be the 'Shroom and Swiss burger or the A1 Peppercorn burger (sans the A1 sauce for me!) The steak fries are bottomless, and I usually get mine extra crispy or with Parmesan Garlic-much better than just the standard ones! The Patty Melt is also delicious, as well as the Chicken Caesar wrap. Really I'm not sure if I have ever had anything here I hated. They make delicious different kinds of lemonades and other specialty drinks that are worth a try. Can get pretty busy on the weekends, so there can be a wait. But the service is usually pretty good, I've never had a complaint!

Great burger; great experience. A busy Saturday night and a party of twelve good cause a challenge for even many good and enjoyable restaurants. Red Robin recently did more than take it in stride, they made it look effortless and our entire party, from 7-70 enjoyed a great time in our noisy little corner of the world. If I'm going to eat a burger, I want it to not only be good, by have a lot of creativity. Red Robin, as in every visit at this location, was the perfect and delicious choice for us.

We have been coming here for years. There have been a couple of times when things weren't quite right and I let my server know. She had the manager to my table in a couple of minutes asking me what my concerns were. They fixed everything and comped some stuff for our troubles. This is customer service at it's finest. I know it's a chain but they have interesting food and burgers. In addition they add special creations so it's fun to try something different. Bottomless fries are always a big hit with the family. Red Robin in Eugene will continue to get my loyal business.

I have (sadly) been here twice within the past 4 days.  I'm thoroughly disgusted with myself because I cannot count how many steak fries that means I ate. Last night I downed two freckled strawberry lemonades (delicious, but don't expect fresh strawberries).  A few days ago I had the cod fish sandwich, and last night, the fish & chips.  The Fish & Chips is a LOT of fish so be warned.  I ended up picking off the deep fried coating just to eat the fish, which actually was pretty good! We had a stack of onion rings but out waitress forgot our barbeque sauce.  She also forgot the cup I asked for to put my ketchup in.  I never got a water, so I had to ask for one.  We also had to ask for napkins. To sum up the service at this restaurant - the waiters/waitresses always seem rushed, flustered, and forgetful.

I really do not get why this place has such good ratings. I was dragged here, not by choice, and my fries were limp and cold and the burger was nothing I couldn't get anywhere else.  Service was SUPER slow and I had to find a waiter to get napkins and silverware. I will not come back here ever again unless I am being pulled by my feet, crying every inch of the way.

I can't believe this place is rated so highly by others.  It's a glorified McDonalds.  Sure the foods a little better, but the prices are A LOT higher and if you squint just a little you will swear (from all the bright colors, neon lights and screaming kids) that you're in a McDonalds... so why would I pay $12 for a meal?  I'll go to one of the dozens of other restaurants in Eugene for a better meal, better prices and a better atmosphere.  Unless you have kids... then I can see the appeal.

Ok food but worst customer service. The manager had my daughter in tears. Daughter lost some of her money in the game machines and was made to feel bad about it. My daughter is 10 and earns her own money to spend. If the machine takes her money then she should get a refund. The manager told my daughter it was absurd that she would try the machines more than once if they were taking her money. ( She used more than one machine and they DID NOT have out of order signs on them). She was told that they don't own the machines so they can't do anything about refunds. Now that sounds absurd to me. I can't believe they are not smart enough to realize that kids are going to use these machines with the idea that they will work and if they don't they should be able to provide a refund. My wife talked with the manager and she was not apologetic or understanding at all. She asked my wife why my daughter  would use machines that are broken. She would not have used them if they had signs on them. We eat here once a month and I can tell you that we will take our business to another establishment that treats kids as equals. I will be sending this info to corporate.

Okay, I would give this location 5 stars for going above and beyond customer service, but they have a Yelp deal for Seahawks fans and being a Niners fan, I must take away 1 star! After a really long day, my family and I wanted to go out to eat, so I yelped around and (according to Yelp) found that Red Robin was open until 11PM. Wrong wrong wrong! We came in at exactly 10:00PM and found that they were closed, however, the employees must've heard our stomachs grumbling and still took us in! I don't know if it's Oregonian hospitality, but we were so grateful that they let us eat because we were starving! I kept telling everyone that if this situation would have happened in my hometown of SF, they would've said no in a heartbeat. Anyways, our server was really accommodating and brought us everything we needed. Even though the restaurant was technically closed, the employees didn't rush us at all! As for the food and the prices; they're pretty up to par with every other Red Robin. So again, 4 stars for you Red Robin! Remove your Seahawks Fans offer and maybe we could talk 5 stars. ;)
Food is good quality, but lately they have been skimping on the "bottomless" fries.

My sister, brother in law and their two kids came to town today and went to Red Robin for lunch.  It was supposed to be a quick stop on their 12 hour drive. The food was alright and our waitress was friendly but extremely slow and not attentive.  The restaurant wasn't very busy.  I had to ask for a glass of water twice before she brought me one.  It took over 25 minutes for us to be able to order and over 35 minutes to get our food.  We were at the restaurant for over an hour and forty minutes.  Not a very pleasant experience with a 4 and 6 year old that had been in a car for 7 hours.  I have always had a good experience with this restaurant in the past.  After today's experience I won't be going back.

2011: Go to Red Robin for drinks with my wife of 25, we get carded but all she has is some super ghetto 'ID' from her French embassy that gave her a laminated card with her photocopied photo on it for some internal paperwork. Happens to have her birthdate. They accept and we enjoy a great meal and drinks.  2013 try one: They refuse her French official ID card and say they only accept passports. We leave cause there's a 30-45 min wait at the 'family' section. Fair enough.  2013 try two: We're back with the passport and are informed only US passports are valid, restaurant policy. We retreat to the family section for a burger and milkshake. So what, expats can't drink in America? How can a restaurant not accept foreign ID?do they never have foreign customers? Food good. Drink rules horrid for foreign clients.

Red Robin in Eugene, Or seems to be going downhill as far as seating  promptly and food goes. The last three times I've dined there my burger wasn't cooked well done, I had to send it back and wait, wait, wait...then I get the burger with cold fries, the rest of my group has already finished their food.  I'm not going back and don't recommend  this place.

Went here for a late lunch with friends. Ordered a cheeseburger cooked all the way through. When I got my food the burger was noticeably burnt and tasted burnt as well. Some french fries were raw while others were cooked well. The seasoning for the fries is good as always, but there need to be more consistency in the food.

ALWAYS great service, even of there's a mistake, it's taken care of with a smile... Which still counts as great service in my book. Of all the red robin restaurants I've been to, the eugene store has always been the kindest and fastest.

After our last bust-of-a-visit, I was never going back to Red Robin, but the manager gave us a call and offered for us to have dinner on him.  I couldn't turn down his graciousness AND explanation...We were last in around September, and he explained that is the same time when all the college students come back and their crew almost completely turns over with a new set of kids (emphasis on kids).  He went  on to say that although that was probably the reason for the bad experience, it was no excuse. So with a free meal voucher in hand, on to the updated review...We have been back twice since then, once in late January and once in February. 1st off I didn't speak to the manager as he asked when I arrived, I wanted a real sense of what things were like, not what they were like when they KNEW they were being watched.  I am happy to report that things have changed..WHAT A DIFFERENCE.  I think our waitress's name was Carmel both times (stunning smile, full figured gal, dark hair, and super good at her job).  Not only did we get prompt service, but when you bring in fruity-teenagers with you there can be a lot of requests.  She did sooooooo well with all the requests.   The second visit with just my fiance was even better (no kids LOL).  We were getting ready to order and asked Carmel's (???) opinion.  She was upfront about what she recommended and, even better yet, she was spot-on.  The new burgers they have, the one with the arugula and the one with blue cheese and portabello mushrooms were to die for.  And who can pass up on garlic fries!!!  She even brought us 1 of EVERY fry sauce so we could try them. OK Red Robin, you have redeemed yourselves.  Thank you for gracious opportunity to try you guys again!   On a side note...if you are going in around September-ish...be patient (and prepared) it will be likely that some poor new kid is still learning the ropes ;-)  With that knowledge, I WILL be back and be much more forgiving!!!

I'm making this a "conditional review" for now... Management did everything that we'd expect to mitigate a disastrous visit.  I have no complaints against the management at all... === BUT === We came in on a relatively light Sunday night, sat down and ordered beverages and later dinner.  They seated the tables next to us.  THEY ordered.  THEY ate.  THEY left.  We still didn't have dinner.  Dearly beloved asked a waitress why they had been served and we hadn't.  She said something about the kitchen and ran to the manager.  Our food came shortly thereafter.  My wife's chicken salad had warm chicken and cold lettuce.  That's great.  My burger was cold and soggy.  My fries were cold and limp.  I had a bite and put it down.  FEH.  They (the manager) told me they'd remake my burger and it would be right up.  It took less than 2 minutes.  Darn hot and tasty burger with crisp and hot fries.  Waitress (who had been absent) asked how everything was.  She dropped off the check.  She came back in about 3 minutes and refilled my iced tea.  She came back 2 minutes later and asked if she could take the check.  She came back 5 minutes later and asked if she could take the check.  I had paid with a really fair tip on the full check (which was reduced by management).  When the waitress returned she said "do you need any change"?  and then left.  I called her back and said: "If you paid 1/3 the attention to us BEFORE the check came as after... we would have had a better "RED ROBIN" experience."  Her reply was of the quality of: "Yeah, I'll have to work on that". As I said before, the management did all they could to mitigate the damage, but, frankly--- if you get Madison for a waitress... you've been warned.  How very sad.

Well the only reason they get a ONE STAR is 'cause of their bottomless fries and the fact that they have a gluten free option.  We got there and I understand 10 people in a party is A LOT but if you tell us that it'll only be a 25 minute wait that morphes into a 45 min wait people WILL GET RESTLESS. My cousin called ahead asking if they could make reservations cause 10 people HELLO? Upon having been told no that we can't make reservations we got there at 5:30 and weren't seated until 6:20pm! Okay by that time my 9 year old son was bouncing off the walls and all they could do was give him OYSTER CRACKERS why'll waiting!  When we finallly got in it was another 20 minutes till we got our drinks and another 15 minutes until we got our food! My grandma who is the sweetest 90 year old lady there is (unless you infringe on her happy hour WHICH THEY DID) she was grumbling about not having her drink.  The sandwhich SUCKED! I got the Tereykai burger (I didn't want to waste any more of my grandmas money). I asked them if they poured on the sauce of cooked with it. Well after learning that they just poured it on I thought that it would be okay with the swiss chesse and pineapple. NOT! The pineapple was VERY THIN hardly taste it AT ALL and the cheese? Well lets say my sister pointed it out and asked me why I had a huge mushroom in my sandwhich! I can make it better at home!  Well my son had the spagettie and fries but by the time we GOT the spagettie he was almost all full of fries! But he powered through the spagettie and ate half of it. He liked the choclate milkshake better then the spagettie!!  The waitress was the only saving grace, she was nice and patient with my son, grandma, uncle and dad all of which who are VERY picky. She warrents another 1/2 star but needless to say I'LL NEVER GO BACK, EVEN IF THE FOOD IS FREE!

Not so happy with this place. I hear grunting from the kitchen!  This review was much more lengthier when I started on the day of my check in here. We are paying customers who chose your establishment. I will not visit you again.  The staff's attitude was horrible.  There were 27 of us who came here and each of us paid about $11 for our food.  I am sure you received an overtime pay. Possibly a decent tip from us combined!  You guys were about to close the night we came by.  Person on the phone told us that you were closing at midnight and we were there at around 9:45p. We still had to wait to be seated for another 15 minutes? The goal on your staff board which says about 'us' customers clearly was not met that night.

I once again find myself screwed over by red robbin. Our onion rings were crumbly, the manager gave them to us for free. But we came here for my friends birthday for her free burger. I had just come here a week earlier for a bithday. So you are supposed to get a free burger on your birthday, apparently after a week they changed it so u have to wait 24 hours after signing up for a card to get your free meal. Now we are all paying 10 bucks for burgers that would be half the price anywhere else. Plus the waitress had more air between her ears than brain. IM never coming here again and I suggest that if you are going out with friends find a bar or even dickey Joes is down the street. The chicken on my friends salad was frozen chucked strips, my mushroom burger had no taste, all 5 of us are very disappointed in the service and the food quality.  If you have to choice choose another burger joint,close to $10 for a burger that tastes like McDonalds,  hell McDonalds is better than this place. Kudos to the manager for trying, but 10 bucks off of a 70 dollar bill is not going to salvage my dinning experience.  My friends birthday is ruined and we have nothing to show for it. Seriously don't go here.

sh*ttiest service I have ever encountered. staff member was chewing gum on the job and the worst attitude ever. great job robin for ruining your good food with the horrible service. you guys should pay more attention to service because it debased my order and time.

We come here for a late night dinner on our busy days once in a while. I love the bottomless fries and I don't eat fries much. I think it's because I like the honey mustard dressing to dip the fries in. I have never had a problem with the service. Knock on wood, and I have been a patron since they opened their doors here in Eugene. The blta is one of my favorites, I usually cancel the fries and get the freckled fruit with it. The salads are pretty good but when I am in the mood for a burger weather it's chicken or beef I like almost everything on the menu. They banzai is really good. Last time I went in I didn't feel like any of my usual stuff so I went with boring ole clucks n shrimp. It wasn't bad. I can't say it would be my usual fare but it was a nice change. I did like the coleslaw. Love the freckled lemonade but I don't order it too much because its too filling.
So slow and the food wasn't anything memorable. Over priced ciabatta burgers that were far from gourmet. Just because it's a chain doesn't mean they are consistent . Learned that the hard way.

No Gluten Free paper menu. Will not go back You have to go on line or go onto there Web site We spent a hour looking on there Web site Which was trying to find needle in haystack. I had been there before so for me I ordered lettuce wrap turkey burger with sweet potatoes fries. There Gluten free menu is very limited. Also no prices were available for us to view.

Every time we have eaten here our food has been cooked the way we wanted it. The whiskey river chicken sandwich is my favorite along with the fries with plenty of campfire sauce for dipping! The service has always been good ad well. Overall this is a good place to eat.

Baileys with Oreo Shake was awesome, But that was all.  Fries are endless but not always consistent. Chicken strips are mediocre and burger bun is usually soggy on the bottom.  Will come back for Shake and fries, but that's it.

Drove up from San Francisco to Portland yesterday, decided to stop for dinner in Eugene.  RR had always been a great place before.  In fact, I worked at one for a number of years.   When we arrived, we sat in the bar, the server came up, and honestly she just seemed tired or worn out.  My friend arrived and we all ordered.  The one and only thing I asked was for fries before our meal because we hadn't eaten all day.  The server responded "It's busy, I don't know if the kitchen will let me."  So, we never got fries, until our burgers arrived.  As soon as it did, our server asked if everything was ok, but we hadn't even taken bites yet.  My wife had Macaroni and cheese with riblets, but the Mac was pretty bland, not what we've experienced before at other RRs.  The next time we saw the server was when we were basically done with our meal, and "then" she asked if we wanted more fries. Having worked at a RR before, I would never make an excuse to a customer "The kitchen won't let me."  It's a customer who's paying for something in your establishment!  How you answer is - "Of course."  It would be one thing if I was being unreasonable, but I don't believe I was.  Anyway, I'd skip this place, they've let their standards slip.
How many birthdays have been had at Red Robin? That's why we ate here. The food is good and chain store predicable. That's great if they sing to you and give you a sundae! BOOM!!

Delicious food.  SLOW service.  Took forever to order, to receive our food, to get drinks refilled, to get our check. The table was grimey the floor was oily feeling under my shoes and the table was slipping around. Unfortunately I was very irritated during my visit and I don't plan on coming back anytime soon.
Amazing server. Carmel made us laugh, chose my food and let us sample her favorite sauces. Excellent customer service. Very personable.

Overall it's good but a bit over priced.  Seated immediately, helped quickly. Got a Freckled Lemonade which is a way overpriced, glorified Strawberry Lemonade. Still pretty tasty! I like that they had a smaller onion ring tower because there was just two of us, not hungry enough for a full tower (or even my whole meal for that matter) but the onion ring tower is kinda their thing so I recommend it. Everytime I come here the onion rings are perfect, but this time some of them were a little burnt, however still edible. The campfire sauce with it is yummy. Our server Michael was really friendly and definitely a hard worker. He delt with my substitutions with no issue.  I ordered the Guacamole burger. I substituted for the jalapeño bun, arugula and pepper jack cheese. The bacon was perfect. The patty was perfect. I ordered it a little more pink than it came, but it was almost spot on and ended up being really good.  The jalapeño bun wasn't as spicy as I expected but I really wasn't sure what to expect. Overall an awesome burger, but it would of been nice if it were a bit smaller. Just a nit picky thing though. I ordered a salad with my burger. It wasn't amazing or anything, just a basic salad. The bleu cheese was real bleu cheese though, other places tend to have a dressing that seems like ranch with a few bleu cheese crumbles. My partner's burger was really good. You could definitely taste the flame-broiled taste of the "Big Tavern". It kinda reminded me of Burger King to be honest, but he loved it so I'm sure it must of been better. The restaurant was pretty mellow this time, it can get pretty loud on occasion. Everyone has always been really friendly. They do a special birthday song for birthdays and even a few dessert I believe. Bottom-less fries too! I will go back, mostly because I live nearby but if it was on the other side of town, I can't imagine driving too far to go there.

I think I should've heeded the signs as I walked in and overheard some of the patrons that we're leaving saying "well they should know if their food is not tasty and the place is dirty". Well, at least I wasn't surprised. We ordered a chicken entree, burger and sweet potato fries. The food was mediocre, and the sweet potato fries came out just shy of warm. The most unappetizing feature of our visit was the very sticky table and the filthy highchair that they brought out for our kid. And I know that it was truly dirty because after wiping it down twice with wet wipes, it was still sticky, which leads me to believe that they hadn't sanitized any of their furniture in a while.  I hope it was just this Red Robin restaurant, either way, I will not be returning.

Had the worst service ever! We waited 10 minutes after being seated to get our drink orders in. My son and I ordered appetizers that came out half cold. Then he had to go to the bathroom and our table was cleared off before we finished eating. The manager had the audacity to blame me for our food being cleared away because I didn't check in with someone before leaving the table to go to the bathroom!! If my child has to go to the bathroom I'm taking them and not waiting around for the waitress to return before leaving my table. Overall worst service I've experienced in my life and will drive to Albany to go to Red Robin next time.

The only time we eat here is for birthdays, which makes the service we receive that much worse.  In July,  we had a 20 minute wait,  then we're seated at a table on the main thoroughfare.  The waitress was rude,  I kept getting bumped by customers and wait staff,  and my kids' food was forgotten about until I asked where it was.   Tonight,  another birthday,  a 30 minute wait for a table, a waitress who actually yelled at my child for ordering food when she was taking drink orders, and a 30 minute wait for food that was cold by the time we got it.  And then the waitress couldn't wait to give us our check.  Both visits resulted in a $60 check, noise levels so loud you had to yell across the table to be heard,  and a manager that could care less.  We won't be going again.

First time going to red robin. We stopped in on a friday night round six. There was a short wait. They were packed to the gills. Our service was very fast and friendly. I had the bleu burger and steak fries. My boyfriend had the whiskey river i think it was called. We both enjoyed our meals. Our daughters burger was just a plain old burger with nothing on it, but she seemed to like it and our son had the 6.99 special. I would not mind eating here again.

Terrible service! Meet family here to eat dinner. 4 adults and 2 children. We waited 45 minutes to be sat. Only got the table because the party in front of us left. I asked the hostess how much longer. And she said they would clear that table and reset it for us. I asked why they left. She said like us they waited a long time. Needless to say... Server took a long time to get our order. Oranges for the kids to calm them done took 15 min or more. drinks took longer. And bottomless fries took forever. Point is... Better be patient cause service sucks!!! Food tasted good.

Red Robin used to be a happy welcoming place with  comfort food that usually hit the spot. Yesterday proved Red Robin is no longer that place. My husband, nearly 2-year-old and I arrived before the dinner rush and were immediately seated. We had a busy day in Eugene and wanted to eat before the hour drive home. Our server was a young women with resting bitch face and a fake smile. We asked for some bottomless fries because we would order some burgers and my daughter would love to snack on them while we choose and ordered and waited. Resting Bitch Face (RBF) essentially told us that the fries could not be served before the meal, and that they were only bottomless for the one diner, and if we intended to share they would not be bottomless. I was appalled that sharing what would likely be 6 French fries with a nearly 2 year old was not allowed in this "family" restaurant. RBF suggested we order a children's meal for her and she could have French fries with it..... Oh yes, please serve my 1 year old a whole hamburger-that makes sense. Ultimately we ordered a whole side of fries so we could give her something to snack on while our food was prepared and enjoy what used to be the "bottomless fries" this restaurant was known for. We normally get a strawberry lemonade to share, but we wanted to try some new purple pear lemonade drink, which was served warm with ice, which was odd. We switched back to regular strawberry lemonade, which is no longer served with lots of delicious sugary strawberries, but only one frozen one, with some watered down lemon water. Sad sad these Red Robin staples are disappointments now. I ordered chicken strips with Mac n cheese to share with the little one. It was advertised as a new favorite on the menu. The "Clucks" we're good, but the Mac n cheese was nothing more than noodles with cheddar cheese melted on top. Disappointing for a restaurant known for comfort food. Overall our RBF server was slow, rude and did not represent what used to be a family restaurant.  We get the impression red robin is trying to become more of a high end bar food scene. This family is not impressed.

Dirty glass!! Not once, but several times. Oh man! It seems like it happens often that there are particles of who knows what plastered on the inside of the water glasses. If that isn't bad enough, the manager wants to explain that it isn't a big deal, as "eco lab" is aware of it and doesn't have a problem with it. I don't know who Eco lab is, but floaters in my drink is just plain gross. Here's a good one...they brought us another glass with sticky lemon pulp dried on the outside. This saddens me because I love Red Robin's burgers. I just don't like the burgers floating around in my drinks.

I first want to say, I usually love this Red Robin! Love the pictures on the wall, the milkshakes, the fries, and even the atmosphere or the spunky waitresses and waiters. Today changed my mind completely.... It takes a lot to do that for this place.  Service was a one star at best, never checked on us and when we needed our first glass of water...we had to flag her down. Pictures are gone and the new ridiculous black computer screens on the table take away from the personal feel that I want with my friend or significant other I go with. We tried to move it to an empty table that didn't even have one and the manager came and moved it back to the table!  There is much more I could type, but already this review is getting lengthy. Good luck.

The food was good, but service was not impressive. They started by seating us in the furthest back corner, at a dirty table. When I asked them to wipe it they wiped the bench first, then the table with the same cloth (can you say health code violation???) Our server was new, and being trained, so no big deal on little errors. However, when our food came out the person bringing it dropped it off and ran. I was in the middle of saying they forgot my dipping sauce and he walked off. At the end of the meal the server said if your paying cash you pay me, with a card you pay through the machine and walked off. Didn't give us a chance to answer one way or the other. I don't understand the fascination with everything being done through the little electronic machines at our table. Isn't that part of the dining experience? Actually having a server???

I brought my family to this restaurant  (9 adults and a 14 month old). When we arrived, the restaurant was mostly empty, but they refused to seat us, saying we were too big a party and would have to wait until the next shift started. While we were waiting, they sat at least 5 parties of four. They obviously had the seating and staff to accommodate our group, but they still kept us waiting. Their attitude was poor and the wait was uncalled for. I won't be returning. Red Robin has good food, but this establishment has no sense of customer service.

Today I really needed a good burger and Red Robin did not disappoint. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with bottomless fries. It was quite busy with the lunch crowd but the staff was still friendly.  The only problem was the bottomless fries were not forthcoming.  When my burger arrived the portion of fries was quite small. I tried using the electronic menu toy that is on the table to signal our server yet she never came back. So I felt a bit slighted that even with the hi tech gadgets on the tables I still could not get a server to come get an order for drinks or refills.  The burger was quite delicious and I will go back, but if they offer a special like bottomless fries and don't come through on their promise, there will be no tip and it will be my last visit.

I love Red Robin. Great food , good service. I just wish they hadn't changed the recipe for the garlic fries. They used to be tossed or sprinkled with garlic oil or garlic butter, now it is a powder sprinkle. I don't like it, it is not as tasty!  Not good!

My husband and I took my best friend here for her birthday yesterday evening. My husband insisted on going to red robin because of the bottomless fries. We show up and they aren't too busy. We walk in and there is no hostess in sight to seat us. It was actually kind of awkward. We eventually thought maybe it was seat your self, so we did! We sat down and the hostess kinda of abruptly came up and said 'here's your menus' in a rude way and walked away. Kinda like she was mad we didn't wait for her..but we did and no one came so we took it upon ourselves to sit down. Then our waitress comes and takes our order. We ordered our appetizers and drinks and food at the same time. We got our drinks and appetizers about ten minutes later and everything was really good (so far).. We finished our appetizers and kept waiting for a good 35 minutes for our three burgers and bottomless fries.. After waiting for 35 minutes our waiter came and said 'they somehow lost your order slip' and he was very sorry and that we can get free dessert. Ok that's fine. So we wait another 25 minutes and we get our burgers. The fried were cold and not good and the burgers seemed to be slapped together. At this point I was over the whole thing. I didn't want dessert. I just wanted to leave. I think the waiter saw my disappointment and came back and said that they were going to take off our appetizers from the total instead of dessert, which was awesome but the whole experience was just not up to par. Not to mention the whole time we were sitting there waiting that 'hostess' kept walking by our table and giving us dirty looks like she was still mad about seating ourselves.. All in all just wasn't a good experience for the amount of money we spent. Most likely won't be coming back to this location for awhile....

Can't get a rare burger because they don't grind their meat in-house. The gourmet burgers really aren't. A step up from fast-food burgers, but the cost isn't worth it.  Server doesn't pick up your card anymore - you have to run it through a machine to cash out.

So I should have wrote this review a few weeks ago but did not know about yelp yet. I visited this Red Robin and I will not visit another. My family was in town and we decided to go here for lunch. It was during the special olympics fund raiser and we were excited to donate and help a good cause. It was busy but I understood that, we placed our order and as we waited patiently for about 30 minutes our appetizers arrived but were given to the table next to us. They had just sat down 10 min prior so we all just laughed about it and thought it was an honest mistake. We were told our food would be right out and that they would bring our appetizers with our food. After waiting for another 30 min (now an hour) we still had no food, drinks or appetizers. I again waved for our waitress and she said she would check on it but never returned to give us an update. After another 30 min we decided that we would just leave. On the the way out I stopped a manager to tell them we were leaving and to explain why and he said "oh sorry about that". That was it. There was no trying to figure out what happened or trying to accommodate us. We just left and will not ever visit a Red Robin again.

Haven't been here in a while. Stopped in for a 15 dollar two burger's and either one appetizer or one dessert special I got in my e-mail. My 8 year old got a meatball kids meal with a smoothie and was really happy with it. Service was quick and woah, I had to look outside and make sure we were in the right place. They renovated and the place looks great. Modern setup with very attentive waitress and this cool tablet on the table that summons your waitress, takes orders and offers some games for those who want that kind of thing. I never felt pressured to use the fancy tech and ended up ordering dessert on it later. Drink refills were fast, plentiful and free. Burgers were great and fries with campfire sauce were excellent!  The star was the dessert. A tower of mini donuts, that were light, hot and came with great dipping sauce.   Spent 40 bucks including tip and would do it again.

This experience was much better than the last one. We went in for a quick late night snack after a movie Friday night. We wanted to sit in the bar because we didn't want a full meal.  Mara was the bartender and she did good. We just wanted a couple appetizers and a side salad for me. She took our order, noting I didn't want tomatoes on my salad, which was made correctly.  She checked on us regularly, being my husband was apparently dehydrated and drank 4 large glasses of water, so she was constantly refilling it for him.  The food was good. We had mozzarella sticks, fried zucchini and voodoo fries, along with my side salad. My salad was ordered without tomatoes and made correctly.  My only real complaint was the fries touted a ghost pepper sauce on it with jalapeños. It wasn't hot at all. Not sure why, but I expected better in terms of that part. I fully expected my sinuses to be cleared out and a tear or two. Honestly, I've had Chinese hot mustard that did better in terms of fire.  They have (along with every other restaurant these days) those stupid kiosk/iPad looking things to order appetizers and desserts on. You can play games on it and pay for your check as well. I despise these things because it's simply an excuse for a waitress to be lazy, and only do half their job, so I refuse to use them. If I am going to use it, I want to order everything that way and just have an expediter bring it to me. Not half of it there and half through a waitress. The other thing that irritates me with this system is when you're using it to pay the bill, it automatically suggests leaving a 20% tip. If I'm using that bullshit thing, I'm not about to leave 20%, when they've only find half their job! They either need to fully replace the wait staff with those or not use them at all.

I have been back to Red Robin several times since my previous review and I have to say, the experience has gotten better.  First of all, expect Red Robin to be busy!  If everyone in your party is 21+, try the bar for seating... we have had great luck on finding seats while there was a 15-20 minute wait for regular seating.  They now have little tablets at every table which is great if you need the server, want to order more drinks, or my favorite: pay your bill on it without having to wait for the server! Just a heads up... You unfortunately cannot put in an app order until your server has put in your first drink order.... we learned this after about 7 minutes of trying to figure out why we couldn't order it! I have had good luck with their regular fries (unlike the sweet potato fries).  They have always been warm and well seasoned.  If you are looking for something new to try, try the cookie shake and ask them to add Bailey's Irish Cream to it, it is DELICIOUS.  Also try their campfire dipping sauce, it comes with their onion rings but is also great for fries.  This restaurant has definitely become one of my favorites when I am in the mood for a well made burger. Can't wait to go back.

My family and I have been to Red Robin many, many times. The ambiance and the food are usually pretty good. I was there recently with a party of 10 (two children 2 and younger) on a Friday night. We were going to start dinner at 6pm, so my folks got there at 5:45pm and went to reserve us a table. When my portion of the family got there at 5:55pm, the place was starting to get a little busy, but there were open tables all over still. Since there were 6 of us there, I assumed we would be given a table, but we continued to wait while people walking in with groups of 5-8 were being seated as soon as they arrived. I thought that was strange. When the last of our party arrived around 6:05pm, we continued to wait while more groups of 1-7 were seated who had just walked in. I'm not sure I understand why people who have been waiting for 20 minutes couldn't have gotten two tables pushed together (which is what RR eventually did) to get the majority of us seated before the walk-ins. Around 6:20pm we were finally seated. Our waiter was Barryington (I may not have it spelled correctly). He was awesome. High energy. Was busy but still checked on us. Talked to my kids about Dragonball Z (a cartoon -- actually another employee came over and talked to my kids about it too. They enjoyed that.). We got appetizers and they arrived fairly quickly. So we didn't notice how long the rest of the food took (which wasn't really that long considering how busy it ended up being). There was the NCAA tournament games on the TV next to us. Food was good. We got refills on fries a couple times across the table. That's one of the main reasons we go there. The real star was Barryington. Many employees I've noticed can get beat down, lose their energy, and trudge along through the shift. That never happened with him and I am more likely to return (I would go back for the food anyway -- but I am MORE likely to return again sooner) thanks to employees like him. Now if the front desk can just figure out how to get a group a table when there are plenty open in less than 40 minutes, that would be worth another star.

I went to Red Robin in Eugene for my birthday burger. They told me my royalty card is invalid. The manager came to see what he could do. All he said was sorry can't help you. I wish I would have asked for his name to post it in this review.

The sad aspect about giving 1 star is that I LOVE most Red Robin burgers and the fries with that campfire sauce! The problem, which seems to  plague the Eugene restaurant over several years, is horrible service.  I have waited over 30 minutes for a burger on several occasions.  Once when a waitress overhead me commenting about the 30 minute wait, the manager later came to the table and asked us if there was a "problem."  I explained no problem other than waiting 30 minutes for a burger...at lunch on a weekday.  He replied that they were a bit busy.  The restaurant was far from being filled up. Then when someone else finally brings the burger you notice you have no napkin! And even though you asked the waitress for water...it seems she forgot.  Then I had to wait 10 minutes for a check.  You would think when we are all staring at our phones, and no food left on the table might be an indication you are done? No, these are not all peak times.  As a matter of fact one time this restaurant was about half empty. So according to corporate bean-counters, the solution is for the customer to order using a tablet at each table.  (Applebees is doing the same too.)  Sorry...if I want A&W experience I will go to A&W.  Once I got an "entertainment" charge on my check.  Unbeknown to us, my child had pressed "OK" on the tablet.  I asked the waitress about this and she said apparently I had played some games.  I explained that we did not, and she shrugged her shoulders and said "sorry." That is horrible customer service.

Aside from a great kids menu, I ordered this w hisky bbq chicken salad which the bbq whisky sauce was tasteless on the chicken chicken was dry and not enough dressing at all  even my grandaughter order a small salad and only a tad of dressing was given  other times i have found burgers to be tasteless  i am not thrilled with red robin myself too expensive burgers   best burger is a guacamole burger think tis called something at the restaurant in sisters, or at the bucking broncho restaurant. i find the environment too noisy and tables so close its like how many people can you jam in to one small area

I always enjoy Red Robin - I'm a little obsessed with their fries. Where I used to live it was the place I would go to be alone, have some tasty food and read. This location is on par with the one I used to frequent. The food is consistent, the service is generally friendly and reliable. I've been sitting in the bar mostly, but this last time I sat in the dining area and felt I got friendlier more attentive service. My server was soft spoken and kind and accommodating. She had a nice balance of "letting me be" and checking in with me. I liked that since I'm not a fan of super chatty servers when I'm reading.  As a side note, I think that people that give a low rating for RR type restaurants are forgetting this is a big box chain. The food never be fine dining, but it'll be tasty for what it is.

While the food is pretty consistent, the service is not. The manager of this restaurant either has no idea how to staff, or is simply oblivious to the problems here. Every single time I have been into this location in the past year, I have seen up to 20 empty tables, and about 30 people standing around waiting for a table. 30 minute wait. Why? Because they are understaffed...at 5pm on a Saturday night...with the NCAA track and field championships in town... Here's a suggestion from an experienced manager: either learn how to staff properly, or fill the front of house first so nobody can see that there are so many empty tables.
Sat at the bar with my friend and Stacy was awesome. very friendly and took care of us the whole time. Couldn't have asked for better service

I was there with a big group tonight and we had potentially the worst service I have ever had in a restaurant. Not only did it take a long time for the food, but some of us had already been there for over an hour before we got our food, and when the food came out the chicken was still frozen. The servers avoided us and made no effort to fix anything or even explain to us why we had been sitting there for an hour without our food. The weird thing was that half our group got their food right away and by the time the other half started to get their food the first half had long since finished their food and paid their bill. When it was time for those of us who waited an hour for our food to cash out none of the servers helped us or offered to print checks or cash us out, so a big group of us all had to use this self-serve credit card machine. There was just a huge lack of any server caring that people hadn't gotten their food and we were never approached by a manager the whole time. Unfortunate! On top of all this the staff made it very clear that they were not happy that a big group of us came in, but they don't accept reservations so I don't know what they expect on a Saturday night. I've never had it made so clear to me that the workers at a restaurant did not want us there.

As always, consistent quality and attentive service, but the beer prices are criminal. $8 for a pint of Good Life, which is made 2 1/2 hours away and does not--as far as I'm aware--contain precious metals or black truffle. Of course, beer is the only thing for which no prices are listed so it's on me for not asking. I'll be drinking water next time.

We love Red Robin. We have been Royalty members since 2010. I am always excited to see a coupon in my inbox. We eat there at least twice a month. I see a lot of complaints about the service at the Valley River location however I am never dissatisfied. My drinks are always full and my food great. We will keep coming back!

The restaurant was so loud. The seat I was sitting had a cold breeze! Red Robin is famous for the bottomless fries and burgers. I like the many choices of burgers available. However most of the burgers taste about the same. The burgers seem fresh but portion is a bit small. The fries are very good but the portion is small. I had to keep asking for a refill which I hate. Overall the food was good but it was very difficult to get the attention of the waiter.

Red Robin has gone to shit. They have pretty good food as always, but there is a very clear loss of service at this location. When I was last there, there was one busser for the whole restaurant so there were tons of empty tables, but the hostesses just stood around and chatted rather than helping out so tons of people were forced to wait up to 20 minutes to be seated. As we were waiting for our food, we could hear waiters airing their dirty laundry saying that one person quit, they were frustrated, etc. There was one manager there who was waitressing and clearly not paying attention to what her staff was doing.  And, what was perhaps even more irritating, the portions have gotten even smaller and the prices have gone up again.  I wouldn't patronize this restaurant since it doesn't care about customer service and has gone crazy with their pricing. I'd support a small, independent restaurant before I'd go to Red Robbin yo money again.

First the positive: Our server was overall great! Burgers were GREAT! FREE birthday burger that is enough for two meals! We paid about $20 for a cocktail, a beer and a desert (although we tipped on the pre-discount amount. NEVER forget to take care of a good server!) We consider that a DEAL!! Thanks... Areas that could improve. the beer took forever, I order my cocktail about 10 mins after we ordered the beer and food and beer and I got my drink before his :( We ordered upgraded fried for each burger (we assumed we'd pay for the upgrades on our Bday burgers, but no. Very cool!)  I ordered the smores fries and my husband ordered the garlic something fries, they were both pretty awesome! The menu says fries are unlimited and when we upgrade to sweet potato fries, they are in fact unlimited. We had no reason to believe that our fries were not, and we were not informed that the two options we picked are not refillable at the time of order.  Also my fries were cool at best, the hot fudge was not even warm, still globby. Under the assumption of refillable fries, I just ate my burger first. I waited to order a hot round until I was actually ready to dive in with undivided attention. I tried that and was informed that I could not get a refill and not offered replacement of the cold fries.  Overall, the burgers and upgrades to the burgers were free! A $50 meal for $20 before tip,  However, getting lesser service because it's free doesn't seem right either (nor do I think that was the cause of the issues.) It's a bummer because service is hit and miss here. The food is awesome but we have had horrible service in the past and FANTASTIC service before. And Friday,  pretty good service but some bumps. We LOVE Red Robin and the food is ALWAYS good. Just service issues like wait time on food, more than one occasion of cold food and things coming out of order like appetizers before drinks and even after the meal has arrived on more than one occasion. These things could be tightened up because this place would be an 8 star venue for a burger joint!
Wow, how long it takes! The kids do like it though.

Love Red Robin but NOT THIS LOCATION! The kitchen staff needs to take their menu test over. I've eaten here 4 times and EVERY time my order is wrong. I even double check what exactly is in the meal dispute it being written on the menu. However, ingredients keep getting added to my food when I was assured that the meal normally doesn't come with that particular ingredient in the first place. What???  The last time I ate there, the table next to me got the exact same thing I did and all 3 of our burgers had something different and something we did not order on it so I know it's not just my bad luck. All the staff is friendly but even when they're not very busy, service is still very slow and they avoid making eye contact so they don't have to come to the table. We were waiting for to go boxes for our order and the check (we were paying cash): I went to the bar, ordered, paid, received a togo milkshake AND finished it before our check ever hit the table. This was on a particularly slow Sunday evening as well.  This location is still operating like it's just opened. I'll be taking my business to BJ's in the parking lot over from now on.

I really enjoy this place! Every time I've gone the waitress or waiter was really nice, easy to talk to and quick on their feet. The food is ALWAYS delicious! And I plan to come back here many many times!!!

My first ever visit to Red Robin was highly anticipated due to the reviews of friends, family, and complete strangers. The menu was extensive and in places, a little confusing. Pub menu? Regular menu?  We all ended up ordering from the regular menu ( I think).... In the meantime, the fries began to arrive and they were pretty good...the basket of fries nearest me was not terribly hot..therefore not as crisp as I would like. Other baskets on the table proved to be hot and crispy. Sprinkled with that signature seasoning they provide...extra yummy.  The food arrived after a slightly lengthy period of time but was worth the wait. I had the shroom burger and it was just what it should have been...cheesy and shroomy, burger cooked pink....not many places give you the "pink" option anymore. So the place was only half full and the service wasn't the speediest, but they were so pleasant and friendly that I'm willing to overlook the not-so-speedy service.  One other small criticism would be the touch screen units on the tables. I don't want to enter my order on a potentially bacteria ridden electronic something or other on my table. Thank goodness I didn't have to - they were happy to take our order the old fashioned way.  Plus its nice to get away from electronic devices for an hour or so. But that's just me... So 4 stars for friendly employees and good food...not great food, but I wasn't disappointed for my first visit.
The burger was great BUT $7.99 for a 16oz. Beer is beyond ridiculous!! That was a mistake and won't do that again. Our service was good for a busy Friday night.

The "Avo-Cobb-O" had barely any actual avocado in it, which seemed ironic since that ingredient is featured in the name. The Sombrero salad was OK.  However, my husband had the worst dirty martini ever. So watered down, it was the homeopathy version of a martini.  I kid you not.
Worst service ever ... sat us at a dirty booth and sat on a half eaten pepper...then continued to push us aside cause we are of a larger persuasion.
Great place to eat if you don't mind being in a loud and very busy place. I like their onion rings and burgers. The fries are all you can eat but I've never made it past the first basket.

First off, I love the burgers here but I want to comment on the renovations they did to this place. It used to be a fun theme of movie posters and the bar section was comfortable away from all the kids. The idea of taking out the comfy booths and replacing them with a backwards half booth/half chair seating is disastrous. It's the most awkward seating and you're so close to everyone now. I think the food is delicious... great burgers and the poutine is tasty. My huge complaint is the changed ambiance that is not comfortable.

According to my company's  rules we are to avoid dining/seating in areas used primarily for alcohol sales.   Today  When I arrived , I was told by greeter/host that  he was sitting me in the lounge, I asked for a table on the main floor, host sighed and said " I don't have a table for 1  unless you sit in the lounge. I tried to explain that I cannot sit in the lounge - Mid sentence i was told OK-you're going to have to wait.  While I was waiting 4 new tables (with out reservations) arrived and were seated in the restaurant. I then left to fund a place that was a bit more customer oriented.    Recently (within the last 2 months), I have experienced the similar responses 2 other occasions which leads me to believe this is a reflection of this locations  management teams service philosophy.   I will not go back.

Came in at 4:45 PM. The place was not at all crowded maybe 1/4 full. No one waiting ahead of us. Told them there were 9 people in our group and we were told...45-50 minute wait!!! Because "we are waiting for your server." They only have one server who can serve 9 people?! Poor management and service. They missed out on a big check and tip.  *Went back. Same exact experience.  Ridiculous.

The staff was great, they let me know about a promotion that was going on. A great hamburger with pretty much any option you would want on it. Great sauces for the burgers and dipping fries. I'd equate it to in and out burger, but a little better quality without the lines and hubbub.

The only reason I went here was because I am all about the whiskey bbq chicken sandwich and the strawberry lemonade.  Those two things is what makes my day! Also, I had a free burger for my birthday month. I don't know what it is about Red Robin, but no matter which one I go to they always make some type of mistake.  This time was no different. I ordered garlic fries and they didn't come.  Also the tablets they have at tables are no fun when you have kids around and all they want to do is touch them or keep insisting on playing a game. Another thing is the tables suck and keep moving or shifting on you.  The staff was good and friendly as for refilling drinks and just having a good attitude. I guess I am used to going here and just expecting something being done wrong, but when you crave a whiskey bbq sandwich, well you just gotta have one!

My family and I went to Red Robin last night for dinner. I ordered just a regular hamburger with lettuce, tomato, pickle, and cheese. When they brought out my burger it was cold. Second, I thought with a burger place they would actually hand-make the patty, or at least make the hamburger patty look like it was hand-made. Nope, my hamburger patty was a nasty, frozen patty that I could have bought from the local grocery store. It was nasty! Honestly, McDonald's down the street would have been better than the burger I ate last night! Our service was horrible. Our lady seemed to be spread between too many tables. She only checked on us once, only to refill a drink. She never asked if the food tasted alright, or if we needed anything else. When we were about halfway finished she asked what we were paying with, said she would bring us our box. She basically kicked us out the door. The bathroom was also a disgusting mess. The floor was wet with who knows what. The toilet paper holder was broken. Last the changing table was unclean and gross. It felt like a gas station bathroom. Altogether it was not a pleasant experience.

My son took me out to lunch this is one of his favorite burger spots. With the rewards card every 10th burger is free.  I love their wedge salad which is on their appetizer menu, and onion rings one of my weaknesses regarding fried foods so so good. Their burger options are numerous and there's often a new burger to try. Cons of going here is that its  often loud and crowded not much privacy.  Wait staff is consistently pleasant.  My sons favorite appetizer is their mozzarella cheese sticks. Fries are bottomless and they provide a fry seasoning at table if you prefer more then what they use.  All in all a safe bet to get a consistent good burger if in the mood.

What can you say bad about Red Robin, not much. I enjoy everything. We ordered some different stuff than normal. The orange cream soda meh not like the orange soda we all know and poppin purple lemonade has an odd flavor...chemical almost! Then I got Irish beer shake...omg the best! Then we got the fried pickles, so good and the artichoke and spinach dip. Good but I've had better.

Service was great, sweet staff. Couple down falls, drinks were made weak and since they're expensive as hell I thought I'd get a lil more than half a shot. Also ordered the red tavern burger which was good, tomato was thin and small only one piece and a soggy small piece of lettuce. Everything else was great, always the best fries!

I ate at the Eugene Red Robin tonight in the bar.  I ordered my food and was very clear about my garlic allergy.  My husbands food was delivered while I had to wait for mine because they put garlic on my burger and it had to be remade. I was offered no fries during the extra wait.  Then when my meal did come, my fries were seasoned.   I asked the waitress if they used the typical seasoning for seasoned fries because I know it has garlic in it.  The waitress assured me that there was no garlic on the fries and the cook wouldn't have used it because he knows it has garlic in it.  So I trusted her and ate the fries.  And sure enough before I even left the restaurant, I started getting sick in the typical way that occurs when I accidentally have the misfortune of consuming garlic.  They gave us my meal for free.  I would rather not be sick and had an enjoyable evening out.  If you have food allergies, stay out of bar seating.  It will not be managed well.

I have always been fan of Red Robin since I've been a kid. I was afraid to come in after so many years, afraid that what I loved about Red Robin would be long gone. I was surprised and overjoyed to see and taste that Red Robin was not just still really good but they were able to up the game in food and drinks. I had a burger and bottomless garlic fries and every bite was tasty. Being able to order more drinks and food right from the tabletop tablet was great and came right out to us fast.

The food during my last visit here was great. The margarita, according to my boyfriend, was fantastic too! However, the personal drama between our waitress and her boyfriend who was seated next to us upon our arrival made for an uncomfortable meal. We found ourselves trying to awkwardly talk louder while she argued with him or when another waiter had to ask him to leave. He didn't for quite some time but once he did, we were relieved.  Will add that the waitress was trying very hard to diffuse the situation and get him out of there.  Will definitely come back, but I definitely needed to get this review out there.

I have been to this Red Robin lots of times over the years and have always enjoyed it but I won't be back ! I have never waited for over an hour to get COLD chicken fingers or the COLD burger my daughter received the poor waitress was so over worked she had way to many tables which she was also bussing by herself she had no help except for someone to run her COLD food out to her tables it wasn't fair to us or her so Red Robin mgmt if your even listening hire some staff so customers aren't served COLD over priced food oh and by the way don't get there clucks n fries it was 4 McDonald nugget sized for over 11 dollars
Love their garlic endless fries. The burgers are delicious. The service is impeccable. Highly recommend. Great family atmosphere. Love red Robbin.

Very disappointed after our trip here. My son and I both ordered our burgers with "some pink". What we got were hockey pucks with no juice at all. Pointed it out to the waitress and her response was a vague "well I guess they could be remade".  However it had taken 45 minutes to get our food, so we declined. We are new to Eugene, but will try a local place next time.
Not sure what the big deal is, burger was just ok for the price,  I will go to Carl's Jr.

Disgusting...... smelled nasty, small booths with the worlds biggest and stickest menus ( guess to match the dirty table ), stuck up waitress, bathrooms that make a outhouse seem like a luxury, should I continue????? Rating would be a negative 10 but it makes u choose at least 1 star......f#&!

Absolutely the worst case of discrimination that I have ever seen!!! Every time my guy and I go here we are treated like a homeless person who is asking to use the washroom, every time we order food from them they either bring the food out stone cold or completely different then what we have ordered.  The reason why we are treated like this is because we believe it is because we both like to wear our favorite bands shirts rather than preppy country club polo Nike branded clothing, another reason we believe this is because we are considered a slightly overweight couple, and tonight was the last straw when a family of 4 came in after us and we were told that it would be a 15 minute wait however because this family was dressed in polo wear and Nike they were seated instantly while we were left waiting. If you don't want to be treated this way don't bother going to this place it's not worth it.
Always have great service and the wait time is always shorter than expected. Best burger and fries in town, and the perfect spot for a birthday dinner!

This is one of the best places to get a burger. Good service, and good fries  However I don't like the little machines that we have to use to pay for our meal, it's a little confusing and hard to use, shouldn't that be part of the hostess job to process the transaction?

Food was delicious. Got seated by young man who immediately sent us to a booth next to kitchen. Floor was extremely slippery.  If we would have tried it get in booth, I definitely would fallen. Even with a trekking pole. As we finished he to a group of very large people to a better booth, slightly bigger than the booth we were asked to sit in.  There was no way this family could have fit in a booth. Get a Host or Hostess with some manners and respect for everyone.  The skinny people were all taken to front of store next to windows and not slippery. If they truly read this I expect an apology from the company on behalf of maintenance and kitchen and host. I asked worker if floor was waxed and he said he didn't have think so. So my thought is it was kitchen grease all over shoes and mops.

We've been huge fans of Red Robin for years, disappointed the last couple of times ,Just not the same. Then ordered online WOW, place was empty for Friday night so I was pretty surprised when I got all the way home to find a entire meal missing. I had to go back after calling, so  I spent an hour basically going back and forth , pretty mad to find instead of making a fresh sandwich they gave me the meal they had forgotten. Nothing like a cold dinner. This is the 4th time it's happened, I know Red Robin is a huge corporation and opening new restaurants daily but if the way I was disrespected by the manager is any indication of how they'll do business, they won't survive.  At least for my family.
I went here September 18 around 4:30 PM with my friend and her fabulous service prices are pretty reasonable food was very good and loved the endless fries

Red Robbins has a good atmosphere. However, my partner and I consistently never get refills on French fries. Usually, we initially receive about 6 fries each, and sometimes we are offered more after we have already paid and about to leave. It is especially frustrating, considering "the bottomless fries" is heavily advertised in your commercials. We will try Red Robbins again, but we have our doubts.

I am writing a review about the hostess, Taylor! She was so friendly and kind to me! I'm a young adult eating by myself and she was super nice and nonjudgmental since it can be awkward eating alone at a restaurant! She was really happy and she seems like a great worker!
We feel sick after we eat here every time so we stopped going. On the bright side the staff is always friendly and we always get great service.

Very mediocre food and staff. My husband hates coming here, so we only come when invited when someone is having a birthday. Their "tavern" burgers aren't good at all, worth it to get their more expensive burgers. Only reason I get excited about Red Robin is because you can have endless sweet potato fries or fruit (or other choices). The last time we came (a couple weeks ago) the service was painfully slow. We came around 1 and had a party of 5 and we were all kind of in a hurry to get back to working and it took over 2 hours because anytime we asked for anything it took 20 min (example:our order, fix mistakes on the food, another basket of fries, check, cash out the check, mess up on the check etc.) I believe she was in training but still, if someone is in training they should only have 1 table, 2 at the most.
They had very good burgers but the service wasn't great. I never got the sauce I requested and the ketchup was empty.

I've eat out at many establishments in my life and I'm not sure what was going on at this restaurant.  Mind you, I've eaten at Red Robin before, but this was my first time at this establishment.  After asking my server if the food I was ordering had Tobasco or Texas Pete in it, I was told that shes not a doctor or nurse and cant tell me that kind of thing. After her explaination of her career choices, I was offered an allergy menu.  Neither item on on their allergy questionnaire on their tablet.  I asked them to just ask the cook.  My server came back with someone, who did not introduce themselves, so I can only assume was their manager.  He told me that they could not divulge that information.  Mind you, during this entire time, we asked for water mutiple times.  I cant contest to the food because of fear of ending up in the hospital.  Very disappointed!  I know the food at other Red Robin's was amazing if that helps!

Never had a RR like this one before.  Seated near the server station, so we got to hear all about the servers' life choices, things like having babies and going to school.  Bottomless fries were either over or under done.  The burger was passable.  Our first booth we sat in smelled like a cat peed in it recently.  We moved.  The bathroom, well, out there in the world are corprophiles, ones who like to paint frescoes in men's rooms with their own issue.  Don't think I'll be using this RR even for takeout...

Just left this location after they told us originally 40-50 minutes and like okay that's fine we understand it's a very busy night but after an hour we checked in and they said 20 minutes so we wait for that. Then a group who came in 30 minutes after us is sat and when we ask they say they were here before you, but we watched them walk in 30 minutes after us. So we asked again how long then and the hostess tells us we don't see a table opening anytime soon. This is some of the worst service I have ever seen. I will definitely not be back to this location. They say "Red Robin Yummm" but at this location it's more like "Red Robin Bummm"

This is a good restaurant for kids, they enjoy it.  The sloppy, uncaring service was a big No for the ones paying the bill, undeserving of it's lackluster 3-star rating.   Took the grandkids here for a special birthday, and the kids had a grand time.  They loved the multiple choices on the kids meal, loved the bottomless steak fries, were thrilled with the singing birthday sundae. We adults didn't enjoy it much.  It was a constant search to find our server, much less get his attention.  We had to beg for more fries, we ordered an appetizer that never came, they brought the singing birthday sundae without notice or prior dessert order, so the other child at the table felt left out until they finally brought one for her.  On the bright side, his IPA and my gourmet burger were fabulous! We went early to ease their accommodation of my service dog. While we try to accept the seating assignment if at all possible, the hostess tried to seat us at multiple inappropriate tables, where my dog couldn't tuck in, and would be tripped over/in heightened distress during the meal.  I finally had to point out and insist on an appropriate booth, where she could tuck herself away in comfort.  Training, please!

I have been to this Red Robin probably 50+ times since it opened. The food is almost always great...I get the same thing every time...The Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap with fries. I will not give 4 or 5 stars because this restaurant smells like dirty mop water EVERY TIME I have been there. There is an all-around dirty vibe about the place if you ask me. I worked in restaurants for about 5 years so I know what restaurant dirty mop water smells like. Maybe I am overly sensitive to smells but surely I can't be the only person that notices it. I have to block out the smell so I can enjoy my food which is yummy. So, besides the lack of proper cleaning, the place is OK. I try to sit in the bar because there are no screaming kids in there!

Showed up for a family dinner and we were clearly there to order food for all seven of us. When I asked the waitress to bring out my bottomless fries out first, she said in the rudest town of voice "we don't bring out fries until you order" when I always do. She was visibly irritated and reflected that towards her costumers. Little to no service, no spoons for the root beer float we ordered and she acted like it was really difficult to get. Just a super negative experience when it was supposed to be a nice, family dinner to celebrate my brothers birthday. It was in the bar area and it was a blonde hair chick. I've honestly never been treated so rudely when going out to eat. What a shame.

Horrific experience that I am still dealing with as I write!  Placed a to-go order at 4:30 tonight, lady was super pleasant relayed my order back to me and it was correct and it would be ready in 15 minutes. Loaded up kids and headed out, and when I walked in I was told by the hostess the carry out gal would be right up. I stood there for 10 minutes waiting so now 4:48(food should be done) when she showed up she said they were out of the kids meatballs I ordered so I asked why no one called me-they took my number when I placed the order.  She said the girl who took my order didn't write it down.  After waiting another 15 minutes to cook something else for my kiddo, the gal came up to me and said it was almost ready. I told her I would like to speak to a manager about getting some sort of discount for the inconvenience and the fact that my other food would now be cold.  The manager offered me a shake or a dessert for their mistake, she said that they don't take that to go orders they have a call center and that was the reason for the mishap.  I waited another 15 minutes for them to plate up my dessert, finally leaving at 5:15.  I used a $50 card to pay for the $30.34 and didn't leave a tip,  and when I went to use the gift card at another place there was $6.07 missing which funny enough is exactly 20%.  When I called the pre-paid credit card company there was a transaction on there for $36.41 at exactly the same time I was at Red Robin.  I called and spoke with the same manager that offered the dessert, and she said the transaction on their end still read $30.34. She said she would get to me by 8pm when she cashed out the carry out server, but didn't call till 10:30pm, and left a message to call back tomorrow.  After three days of checking the card balance I finally saw where the tip was reimbursed to me, however as a former manager of a restaurant this was not the outcome I expected or the service I would have given myself.  Sloppy, rude and completely unprofessional-will never ever go back despite my extreme addiction action to the Blue Ribbon burger.

Lack luster. Best way to describe my lunch there. The BLTA was subpar. It came with a single slice of avocado on one side and that was all... bacon was cold. Almost like it's bought precooked, and the photo is showing how much they put the entire sandwich... Fries were so-so (also cold). This was all checked in my car so to be sure it wasn't just in transit that it got cold... don't think this is something I'll order again and it will be a while before returning to see if some standards have changed.
